en: Medical Clearance: Consult a healthcare professional before starting any new exercise program, especially if you have existing health conditions. Proper Warm-Up: Engage in 5-10 minutes of light cardio and dynamic stretches targeting the chest and shoulders. Use Correct Form: Focus on technique over heavy weights to prevent injuries. Controlled Movements: Avoid rapid or jerky motions. Breathing Technique: Exhale during exertion (lifting phase) and inhale during the lowering phase. Spotter Assistance: When using heavy weights, especially with barbell exercises, have someone assist you. Equipment Check: Ensure benches, machines, and weights are in good condition. Listen to Your Body: Stop immediately if you feel sharp pain or discomfort.
5–10 minutes of light cardio (e.g., arm circles, jumping jacks)\nDynamic stretches focusing on shoulders and upper back
5 minutes of stretching, focusing on shoulders, neck, and upper back

Rest: 60–90 seconds between sets\nFrequency: Perform this workout 1–2 times per week with at least 48 hours between sessions\nProgression: Gradually increase weight or repetitions as strength improves
